comments.article:
Yes, but the Jets still won.

Better 1-1 than 0-2, no?
That stinks. Not a football fan but my fambly makes me pay attention to stuff like that.
comments.subject: I'm sorry

comments.article:
Haha

Go Dockers!

I concur. That was difficult to watch. I've been a Giants fan since the 80s when they beat the hated Bills in the Superbowl. I am not pleased with my other team either, the Patriots (I'm from Boston originally, it's in my blood), but I imagine from your previous entries that you must have enjoyed the drubbing San Diego gave them yesterday.

If it weren't for the G-men, I'd be in for a long season...
Ummm..."Giants Fan", the 'Hated Bills' lost to the G-Men in the 90's.  Time for a blood transfusion.
comments.subject: minor correction

comments.article:
It sucks, but if you asked me at the beginning of the season would I take 4-1 through the first 5 games I'd say yes in a heartbeat.

Besides, now that they've lost I'm hoping this will prompt Jerry Reese to pull the trigger on that rumored Tony Gonzalez trade: http://www.nj.com/giants/index.ssf/2008/10/catching_up_on_new_york_giants.html

Boss may be a good fit in the long run, but he's still kind of raw. Can you imagine if the Jints added TG to their offense. Scary.
My condolences.. I watched it.. but, as a Lion's fan, I can't feel *too* sorry for you. =~_^=  It just sucks it had to happen during MNF..

comments.upictitle: Mister Cellophane...Call me Toulouse: cthulhu fish
comments.article: It could be worse. You could be the Seahawks. This is going to be a loooooooong season for me.
yup...they are looking pretty sad. At the game all the packer fans were acting like it was the superbowl!

Sometimes sports fans forget how little disparity there is between the "best" team in the NFL and the "worst" team.

Watching Cleveland tonight, it is hard to understand how they've only won 2 games. I think they have a tendency not to play hard and fail to execute in key moments.

A big issue is their quarterback situation, as much as people pretend it isn't. I think that if you have more than one quarterback, you don't have a quarterback.
comments.subject: Parity

comments.article:
Eli was bound to regress at some point. He can't be perfect every game.

Heck, the Redskins hadn't had a turnover all year and then suddenly dropped 3 against the lowly Rams.

Yeah, I am a Skins fan who lives in Denver, so the Broncos are my number 2 team. Rough day for me yesterday!

Sorry George. I feel your pain!

comments.upictitle: Canary In A Coal Mine: NYG - Red Jersey G-Men
comments.article:
Yuck.

That's all I have to say about that.
I have a soft spot for the Browns after there complete betrayal by Art Model.They played a great team, but the Giants have looked great all season.I'm sure this was just a blip.
Hmm, I don't follow the NFL very closely, however my beloved Roughriders in the CFL got trounced today, so I feel your pain.
word. That was awful. Even Hamilton scored more against Montreal :(
One heck of a week for the Browns to play like they did last year, eh?

It was a weird weekend all around.

The East lost all except a comeback in SF.
Bizarre.

What's with marching all the way down the field & THEN huddling?

So now let me see if I understand right. We're only going to be allowed to comment on your sports entry's? The comments tended to be quite interesting. I wonder if there is anyway for LJ to block the usual troll suspects from ... well ... trolling.

What's with marching all the way down the field & THEN huddling?

Yeah, that was some really crappy time-management there at the end. Sometimes I don't get Coughlin's strategy.

And the Dolphins lost a nail-biter. Boo for a bad week!

But hey, as others say, the Jets won, and the Patriots lost, and the Cowboys were beaten too. Gotta find the silver lining...
That's pretty descriptive for one word.
but did you happen to catch the Eagles game?  Amazing (or should I say miraculous?) comeback.
Well it could be worse (see userpic...)

Yikes. And I would have appreciated if your boys could have taken care of the Saints for me, but nooooooooo.

;)

Oh Eli. Eli, Eli, Eli.

As a diehard Ole Miss and Saints fan, it's nice to have the boys (Eli and Peyton: we forgive him for going to Tennessee) go out there and do some winning for us.

Though Saints, not entirely shabby this year considering everyone's out on injury.

From your profile pic and comment I deduce you are from the great state of Mississippi. Me too! Yay Mississippi GRRM fans! I'm not much of a football fan, but I do root for Eli even though those Bank Plus commercials are god awful lol.
This is the one time I can't offer condolences. Browns fan from forever. 15-1 should get you back to the playoffs, though, and a chance to repeat. Rooting for them the rest of the way.

Congrats. They took it to the Giants. I heard Romeo last week on NY's premiere sports talk radio show. He seemed to have practical views on his club. As it turned out he was right on his team being more complete for the first time this season.

There was a brief moment toward the end of the first half when the Browns looked like they were remembering that they were the Browns... but it didn't last.  Every time the Browns' own incompetence turned 2nd-and-7 into 2nd-and-12, the Giants seemed to back off and give them 14.  It was weird and unpleasant to watch (I'm not so much a Giants fan as a Browns anti-fan).

Agreed.

That was painful to watch.
As a Ravens fan, I'm there with you.

It was surreal.  They have faced adversity before and stepped it up and played harder, but last night they just seemed to lose heart and give up.  Here's to hoping that this is not a sign of things to come.
